**Health Transformation – Advisor**
=====================================================

### Announcement Information

* **Reference Number**: PW-22-01017631
* **Solicitation Number**: 1000244816
* **Publication Date**: December 16, 2022
* **Tender Closing Date**: January 5, 2023, at 16:00:00 (expired)
* **Contracting Authority**: Indigenous Services Canada (SAC)

### Overview

Indigenous Services Canada (SAC) is seeking a Health Transformation Advisor to provide professional services on a temporary basis. The successful candidate will support the department in its work with First Nations and provinces to develop new health governance models or entities and finalize agreements to transfer full control of federally administered health services.

### Service Requirements

The Health Transformation Advisor will provide the following services:

* Strategic advice and guidance on federal negotiations
* Participation in internal federal and SAC discussions
* Participation in meetings with First Nations and provincial officials to draft health transformation agreements
* Drafting, commenting, and providing input into health transformation agreements
* Participation in trilateral working groups and other committees, as required
* Preparation or contribution of written and oral briefings or policy papers for SAC Senior Management, as required

### Security Requirements

The resource must have a minimum security level of Secret.

### Period of Contract

The proposed period of contract is from January 23, 2023, to December 22, 2023, with an optional additional 24 weeks.

### Estimated Level of Effort

The estimated level of effort for the contract will be full-time.

### Qualified Suppliers

Only suppliers who have qualified under the following stream and category and are hold an active Supply Arrangement under EN578-172870 are eligible to submit a proposal:

* Stream 13: Policy and Advisory Services
* Category 13.4: Policy

Please contact [tpsrgc.pasat-apths.pwgsc@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca](mailto:tpsrgc.pasat-apths.pwgsc@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca) to learn more about the qualification process.
